result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donnell Bruce Finch

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donnell Bruce Finch in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Donnell Bruce Finch.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial held.  Parties remain in trial posture.  Any further motions will be heard on day of trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 11/9/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.
Received and Filed. State's AMENDED Witness List

Defendant Donnell Bruce Finch not in court, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Donnell Bruce Finch.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Jury Trial.  Defense counsel advised Court that defendant was recently taken into custody.  State does not have their essential witness and requests adjourned jury trial date.  Court grants adjournment request.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Donnell Bruce Finch in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Donnell Bruce Finch.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial Conference held.  Parties remain in trial posture and have no further pretrial motions to address.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 10/12/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.
Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. Defense's Motion in Limine

Per defense motion, defendant is requesting modification of no contact order. Arguments heard. For reasons as set forth, Court grants defense motion. Court modified no contact order to NO VIOLENT CONTACT. Court authorizes third party contact for purposes of child visitation as approved by the victim.

Defendant Donnell Bruce Finch in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Court orders any motions and pretrial documents to be filed no later than one week prior to final pretrial. Defense heard as to bail. Case adjourned.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defense Motion to Modify Bond, filed.

Defendant Donnell Bruce Finch in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has not received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered the cash of bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.P.K. her residence, workplace or anywhere she temporarily occupies. No third party contact. No contact with any children that currently resides with JPK.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Donnell Bruce Finch in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg friend of the court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 35 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
